bullets.text: Trump threatens Canada with sweeping tariffs, including 100% if it deepens China ties—raising North American trade uncertainty and supply-chain risk.
Europe’s Greenland shock underscored sovereignty vulnerabilities, pushing EU/NATO toward harder security and economic-resilience planning in the Arctic.
Davos conversations pivoted from AI hype to Greenland/energy geopolitics, signaling investors’ renewed focus on strategic resources and security risk premiums.
Concerns grow that political pressure for lower rates could spur a short-term growth “sugar high,” followed by higher inflation and financial instability.
Berkshire’s new CEO Abel signals Kraft Heinz stake may be written down or exited, highlighting ongoing challenges in legacy packaged-food valuations.
Meta Reality Labs cuts intensified “VR winter” fears, suggesting slower consumer adoption and tighter capital allocation for immersive hardware bets.
Musk’s reported $1T pay package renews scrutiny of CEO compensation and governance, potentially accelerating regulatory and shareholder backlash.
SEC dropping its lawsuit against Gemini suggests a softer U.S. crypto enforcement posture, potentially boosting exchange confidence and market participation.
Up to 67 million Americans could lose telehealth coverage without imminent congressional funding, creating healthcare access disruption and payer/provider revenue risk.
Never-before-seen wiper malware targeted Poland’s energy grid; even a failed attack highlights escalating cyber risk to critical infrastructure across Europe.
Real-world data links EV adoption to measurable air-pollution reductions, strengthening the public-health case for electrification and emissions policy support.
New catalyst enables plastic upcycling about 10× more efficiently than platinum, potentially lowering costs and improving scalability of chemical recycling.
Brain-wave interfaces show progress toward restoring movement in paralysis, signaling accelerating clinical potential and investment interest in neuroprosthetics.
